title: Medical Treatment visa
summary: This page provides detailed information about the Medical Treatment visa (Subclass 602), a temporary Australian visa for individuals seeking medical treatment, organ donation, or supporting someone undergoing treatment. It outlines visa conditions, eligibility criteria, costs, stay periods, obligations, and application requirements.

structured_data.description: A temporary visa for people to travel to or remain longer in Australia for medical treatment, to donate an organ, or to support someone receiving medical treatment or donating an organ.

stay.duration_determination: Determined on a case-by-case basis depending on treatment plan
stay.stay_longer_information: Must apply for another visa if more time is needed

notes: Times shown are based on recently decided applications
Times are indicative only and not specific to an individual application
factors_that_delay_processing: Non-payment of the correct visa application charge

what_you_can_do: Support someone who holds this visa who is an organ donor or receiving medical treatment
Be granted single or multiple entry depending on situation
Study for up to 3 months (or longer if meeting exemption criteria)

situational_requirements: Intend to have medical treatment or consultation in Australia
Intend to donate an organ to someone in Australia
Intend to support a patient or organ donor who holds this visa
Intend to receive an organ from someone traveling to Australia with the applicant
Intend to come under arrangements between the Western Province of Papua New Guinea and the Queensland Department of Health
Be in Australia, aged 50 or older, refused a permanent visa on health grounds only, and be unfit to depart Australia
eligibility.health_threat_restriction: Must not have a medical condition that could be a threat to public health or endanger the community

visa_holding_restriction.must_not_hold: Temporary Work (International Relations) visa (subclass 403) in the Domestic Worker (Diplomatic or Consular) stream
visa_holding_restriction.exceptions: Applicants aged 50+ assessed as unfit to depart after permanent visa refusal on health grounds

financial_capacity.requirement: Must have adequate means to support oneself in Australia
must_cover: Expenses of accompanying persons, including organ donors

must_intend_to: Only undertake activities allowed on this visa
exceptions: Applicants in Australia aged 50 or older, refused a permanent visa for health reasons, and unfit to depart

debt_to_government.requirement: Must have repaid or arranged repayment of debts to the Australian Government

medical_payment_arrangement.requirement: In most cases, must pre-arrange payment of medical costs

support_persons.definition: A family member or another person such as a friend who applies to support the visa applicant
requirements: Must file a separate application unless included in applicant’s passport
Applicant’s visa must be granted before support person's visa

health_insurance.recommendation: Strongly recommended to obtain health insurance for unforeseen medical treatment
health_insurance.liability: Applicant is personally liable for all healthcare costs
health_insurance.adequate_insurance_reference: Information available on what counts as adequate insurance
health_insurance.reciprocal_healthcare: Some countries have reciprocal agreements; information available via Services Australia

travel_conditions.multiple_entry: Can leave and re-enter as many times as desired

single_entry.if_granted_outside_australia: Can enter Australia once; cannot return if departing
single_entry.if_granted_in_australia: Can leave and return once; cannot return after second departure

travel_conditions.verification: Entry type can be checked in VEVO or visa grant letter

visa_label.description: Visa is digitally linked to passport

additional_information.help_with_visa: Applicants should read about who can help with visa applications before paying anyone
